CatDescriptText: Mr. Bob Dittey, painter, of South Side, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "It brings understanding--tolerance, if you want to call it.  I'm Catholic and we have several colored in our parish.  It could be and should be encouraged."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bob Dittey, wearing leather zippered jacket, pinstriped pants, and eyeglasses, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of window displaying lamp and plant, Jenkins Arcade in background, Downtown
